key_points: Jacob Chansley's lawyer offers Chansley as a witness for Trump's impeachment trial.
Chansley was notably dressed in face paint, no shirt, and a fur hat with horns during the Capitol riot.
Chansley is also known as Jake Angeli and the "QAnon Shaman".
He feels betrayed by Trump after not receiving a pardon for his actions during the insurrection.
Chansley and others claim they were incited by Trump to participate in the riot.
He faces multiple charges, including civil disorder and obstruction, with arraignment scheduled.
Prosecutors argue Chansley led a group into the Senate chamber and left a threatening note.
Chansley called the FBI to admit his involvement, calling Pence a "child-trafficking traitor".
He claimed to have come to the Capitol at Trump's request.
Chansley is described as a "self-proclaimed leader" in the QAnon conspiracy theory movement.
